bug.short_desc: Add code for loading screen to the generator output

long_desc.thetext:
It would be nice if the generator injected the HTML and css necessary for a loading screen into the page from script, and does the fading out of the loading screen out before the main() method is called. All behind the scenes, without the user having to change anything in index.html, controllable by config.json directives (off/on; loading/splash image; text; transition effect length, etc. ).
- saves users the hassle to implement this each and every time - allows uniform loading appearance for qooxdoo apps - allows generic/default "powered by qooxdoo" splash screen which could stay even longer than the actual load time -- maybe good for marketing - on slower mobile platforms, prevents "flickering" - will allow to hide the latency of on-the-fly generation of UI widgets from XML/json (they're not there yet, but might be eventually).
Inspiration: http://www.kendoui.com/blogs/teamblog/posts/11-10-06/foujui_flash_of_uninitialized_javascript_ui.aspx
